verses.verse: Now gather<WH1413> thyself in troops<WH1416>, O daughter<WH1323> of troops<WH1416>: he hath laid<WH7760> siege<WH4692> against us: they shall smite<WH5221> the judge<WH8199> of Israel<WH3478> with a rod<WH7626> upon the cheek<WH3895>.

But thou, Bethlehem<WH1035> Ephratah<WH672>, though thou be little<WH6810> among the thousands<WH505> of Judah<WH3063>, yet out of thee shall he come forth<WH3318> unto me that is to be ruler<WH4910> in Israel<WH3478>; whose goings forth<WH4163> have been from of old<WH6924>, from everlasting<WH3117> <WH5769>. everlasting: Heb. the days of eternity

Therefore will he give them up<WH5414>, until the time<WH6256> that she which travaileth<WH3205> hath brought forth<WH3205>: then the remnant<WH3499> of his brethren<WH251> shall return<WH7725> unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

And he shall stand<WH5975> and feed<WH7462> in the strength<WH5797> of the LORD<WH3068>, in the majesty<WH1347> of the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068> his God<WH430>; and they shall abide<WH3427>: for now shall he be great<WH1431> unto the ends<WH657> of the earth<WH776>. feed or, rule

And this man shall be the peace<WH7965>, when the Assyrian<WH804> shall come<WH935> into our land<WH776>: and when he shall tread<WH1869> in our palaces<WH759>, then shall we raise<WH6965> against him seven<WH7651> shepherds<WH7462>, and eight<WH8083> principal<WH5257> men<WH120>. principal: Heb. princes of

And they shall waste<WH7462> the land<WH776> of Assyria<WH804> with the sword<WH2719>, and the land<WH776> of Nimrod<WH5248> in the entrances<WH6607> thereof: thus shall he deliver<WH5337> us from the Assyrian<WH804>, when he cometh<WH935> into our land<WH776>, and when he treadeth<WH1869> within our borders<WH1366>. waste: Heb. eat up in the: or, with her own naked swords

And the remnant<WH7611> of Jacob<WH3290> shall be in the midst<WH7130> of many<WH7227> people<WH5971> as a dew<WH2919> from the LORD<WH3068>, as the showers<WH7241> upon the grass<WH6212>, that tarrieth<WH6960> not for man<WH376>, nor waiteth<WH3176> for the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>.

And the remnant<WH7611> of Jacob<WH3290> shall be among the Gentiles<WH1471> in the midst<WH7130> of many<WH7227> people<WH5971> as a lion<WH738> among the beasts<WH929> of the forest<WH3293>, as a young lion<WH3715> among the flocks<WH5739> of sheep<WH6629>: who, if he go through<WH5674>, both treadeth down<WH7429>, and teareth in pieces<WH2963>, and none can deliver<WH5337>. sheep: or, goats
Thine hand<WH3027> shall be lifted up<WH7311> upon thine adversaries<WH6862>, and all thine enemies<WH341> shall be cut off<WH3772>.

And it shall come to pass in that day<WH3117>, saith<WH5002> the LORD<WH3068>, that I will cut off<WH3772> thy horses<WH5483> out of the midst<WH7130> of thee, and I will destroy<WH6> thy chariots<WH4818>:
And I will cut off<WH3772> the cities<WH6145> <WH5892> of thy land<WH776>, and throw down<WH2040> all thy strong holds<WH4013>:
And I will cut off<WH3772> witchcrafts<WH3785> out of thine hand<WH3027>; and thou shalt have no more soothsayers<WH6049>:

Thy graven images<WH6456> also will I cut off<WH3772>, and thy standing images<WH4676> out of the midst<WH7130> of thee; and thou shalt no more worship<WH7812> the work<WH4639> of thine hands<WH3027>. standing: or, statues
And I will pluck up<WH5428> thy groves<WH842> out of the midst<WH7130> of thee: so will I destroy<WH8045> thy cities<WH6145> <WH5892>. cities: or, enemies
And I will execute<WH6213> vengeance<WH5359> in anger<WH639> and fury<WH2534> upon the heathen<WH1471>, such as they have not heard<WH8085>.
